isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - CUMMINS M11E AND N14E ENGINES - TROUBLESHOOTING - ACCELERATOR PEDAL TPS/IVS - CUMMINS

svcprocinfo.para: The following five tests check the throttle position sensor (TPS), the idle validation switch (IVS) and the related International cab and engine harness circuits connected to the ECM.

note.para: The following four tests, Testing Throttle Position Sensor (TPS - Cummins, Testing Idle Validation Switch (IVS) - Cummins, Testing Accelerator Pedal (TPS/IVS) System for "Short or Open" Circuits - Cumminsand Testing TPS/IVS Circuits for Continuity - Cummins must be performed in sequence.

svcprocinfo.para: The tests should be performed if a Cummins fault code indicates a problem in the circuits or if an electronic service tool Indicates that the TPS/IVS is not working properly while monitoring switches. If the electronic service tool detects a fault with the IVS circuits while monitoring switches, the display would show Idle Validation Switch = Fault. If a fault is present while monitoring Percent Of Throttle, the percent displayed does not indicate actual throttle position.

note.para: Testing Throttle Position Sensor (TPS) - Cummins and Testing Idle Validation Switch (IVS) - Cummins check operation of the TPS and IVS, but do not check the timing between the two functions, which is important.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Throttle Position Sensor (TPS) - Cummins
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the TPS circuits in the accelerator pedal assembly. This test will help identify if the resistances are within specifications and if there are any opens or shorts in the TPS, but will not verify the correct switching of the IVS and TPS.

entry.para: Disconnect accelerator pedal from cab harness at connector (306). At pedal side of (306) measure resistance between terminals A and C with the pedal in the idle position, then with the pedal fully depressed.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins).
With the pedal in the idle position, at connector (306) measure resistance between terminals B and C.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins).
With the pedal in the full throttle position, at conn. (306), measure resistance between terminals B and C. Is reading 1000 ohms less than reading at idle position, and between 250 and 1500 ohms?
250 to 1500 ohms, and < idle position reading -1000 ohms.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins).
At the accelerator pedal, measure resistance between gnd. (metal part of pedal) and terminals A, B, C, D and E.
TPS, A, B, C, D and E to gnd.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration- Cummins).
The TPS sensor checks good. Proceed to Testing Idle Validation Switch (IVS) - Cummins below), which checks the idle validation portion of the accelerator pedal.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Idle Validation Switch (IVS) - Cummins
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the IVS circuits in the accelerator pedal assembly.
Perform Testing Throttle Position Sensor (TPS) - Cummins above, before performing this test.

entry.para: Disconnect accelerator pedal from cab harness at connector (306). At pedal side of (306) measure resistance between terminals F and E with pedal in idle position. Is it <125 ohms?
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins.

At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals F and E while slowly depressing the pedal (idle to full throttle). After approximately 10 degrees of travel, is the resistance 100K ohms or more?
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins)
Remove connector (263) from ECM. At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals F and D while the pedal is at idle position.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins).

At connector (306), measure resistance between terminals F and D while slowly depressing the pedal (idle to full throttle). After approximately 10 degrees of travel the resistance should be less than 125 ohms.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins).
At connector (306) measure resistance between metal part of accelerator pedal and terminals D, E and F.
TPS/ IVS metal to D, E, and F.
Replace the TPS/IVS sensor, then recalibrate (refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins)
The TPS/IVS pedal assembly checks good. Note that this test is not able to check the timing between TPS and IVS functions.

svcsubproc.title: Testing Accelerator Pedal (TPS/IVS) System for "Short or Open" Circuits - Cummins
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the cab and engine harness TPS/IVS circuits for opens, shorts to ground, shorts to "hot" circuits and shorts to other circuits in the harness.

note.para: Perform Testing Throttle Position Sensor (TPS) - Cummins and Testing Idle Validation Switch (IVS) - Cummins before performing this test.

table.title: Testing Accelerator Pedal (TPS/IVS) System for "Short or Open" Circuits - Cummins

entry.para: With (306) disconnected, disconnect connector (263) from ECM and inspect ECM connector. Refer to Inspecting Navistar Engine Harness ECM Connector (263) - Cummins. Connector and ECM pins OK?
Replace connector terminals if damaged. If ECM pins are damaged, have Cummins dealer replace ECM. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate the ECM to TPS/IVS.
At connector (263) use test leads and measure resistance to gnd. at terminals 6, 9, 10, 11, 18 and 19. Do not use probes or leads other than Cummins P/N 3822758 or the connector could be damaged.
Locate short to ground, in circuit where terminal resistance is less than 100K ohms, then repair.
At connector (263) use test leads and measure resistance between terminals 6, 9, 11, 18 and 19 and all other terminals in (263).
(263), between term. 6, 9, 11, 18 and 19 and all other term.
Locate short between any circuits where resistance between terminals is less than 100K ohms, then repair.
At connector (263) use test leads and measure voltage to ground at terminals 6, 9, 10, 11, 18 and 19.
Locate short to unwanted voltage source in any circuit where more than 1.5 volts is present, then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.

svcsubproc.title: Testing TPS/IVS Circuits for Continuity - Cummins
svcsubproc.para: This test checks the individual TPS and IVS circuits (cab and engine harness) for correct resistance while disconnected from the accelerator pedal assembly and ECM.

note.para: Perform the preceding three tests before performing this test.

table.title: Testing TPS/IVS Circuits for Continuity - Cummins

entry.para: At ECM connector (263) use test lead to jumper terminal 11 to 18. At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals B and C. Do not use probes or leads other than Cummins P/N 3822758 or the ECM connector could be damaged.
Locate cause of out-of-specification resistance in either circuit 99 or 99A(5V), then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
At connector (263) use test lead to jumper terminal 11 to 19. At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals A and B.
Locate cause of out-of-specification resistance in circuit 99-G, then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
At connector (263) use test lead to jumper terminal 11 to 9 . At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals B and D.
Locate cause of out-of-specification resistance in circuit 99C, then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
At connector (263) use test lead to jumper terminal 11 to 6. At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals B and E.
Locate cause of out-of- specification resistance in circuit 99B, then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.
At connector (263) use test lead to jumper terminal 11 to 10 ). At connector (306) measure resistance between terminals B and F.
Locate cause of out-of- specification resistance in circuit 99-GA, 97-GA or 97-G, then repair. Refer to Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins to recalibrate ECM/ accelerator pedal.

If all four of these tests have been performed and defects were not noted, the TPS and IVS circuits check good. If the problem is still present, replace the accelerator pedal. If this does not correct the problem, have Cummins dealer diagnose the ECM operation.

svcsubproc.title: Accelerator/ECM Calibration - Cummins
svcsubproc.para: The electronic accelerator pedal assembly and the ECM must be calibrated when:

item.para: The pedal assembly is initially installed.
The pedal assembly or sensor is replaced.
The accelerator pedal is disconnected (at any point in the circuitry) and the key switch is placed in the on position.

svcsubproc.para: To recalibrate the accelerator pedal and ECM:

item.para: The vehicle key must be in the on position.
Depress the accelerator pedal slowly through the complete range of movement, then release. Slowly depress and release, three times in this manner. This completes the calibration process.
